enWisdom: Blessings are stripped away by ingratitude
Many an utterance has taken away a blessing
The cause of cessation of a blessing is ingratitude
The cause of alteration [and removal] of blessings is ingratitude
In ungratefulness for blessings is [the cause of] its removal
Being ungrateful for a blessing causes it to be taken away and being thankful for it causes it to last

Wisdom: كُفْرَانُ النِّعَمِ يُزِلُّ الْقَدَمَ وَيَسْلُبُ النِّعَمَ
enWisdom: Ingratitude for blessings makes one stumble and strips away the blessings
Being ungrateful for a blessing is the cause of its removal
Ingratitude for favours leads to deprivation

Wisdom: مَنْ لَمْ يَشْكُرِ النِّعْمَةَ عُوقِبَ بِزَوَالِهَا
enWisdom: One who does not show gratitude for a blessing is punished by its cessation

Wisdom: مَا أَنْعَمَ اللَّهُ عَلَى عَبْدٍ نِعْمَةً فَظَلَمَ فِيهَا إِلَّا كَانَ حَقِيقاً [أَنْ يُزِيلَهَا عَنْهُ
enWisdom: Allah has not bestowed any blessing on a servant who then does injustice with it but that he becomes deserving of it being taken away from him by Allah

Wisdom: مَا أَنْعَمَ اللَّهُ سُبْحَانَهُ عَلَى عَبْدٍ نِعْمَةً فَظَلَمَ فِيهَا إِلَّا كَانَ حَقِيقاً أَنْ يُزِيلَهَا عَنْهُ
enWisdom: Allah has not bestowed any blessing on a servant who then does injustice with it but that he becomes deserving of it being taken away from him by Allah

Wisdom: لَا تُعِنْ عَلَى مَنْ أَنْعَمَ عَلَيْكَ فَمَنْ أَعَانَ عَلَى مَنْ أَنْعَمَ عَلَيْهِ سُلِبَ الْإِمْكَانَ
enWisdom: Do not help [anyone] against the one who has favoured you, for the one who helps against the one who has favoured him is stripped of his ability
